page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The majority of the population are employed in the tourist and fishing industries.The remainder commute to Plymouth for employment.Very few work on farms.As throughout the tourist industry most of the retail outlets are small and privately owned employing less than 20.This also includes service industries eg:plumbers,carpenters,masons,painters .The town has the third largest fishing fleet in Cornwall and this indirectly employs engineers,shipwrights and welders.Also less than 20 men employed by the Co_operative as fish packers etc.The rate of unemployment for the winter months is approx. 20%,whilst in the summer it is 5%.
